name: Thymosin Alpha-1
description: A thymic peptide that modulates the immune system by stimulating T-cell maturation and function. FDA-approved as orphan drug (Zadaxin) for hepatitis B. Used clinically in over 30 countries for immunomodulation and shows promise for immune aging.

dosage.notes: Subcutaneous injection. FDA orphan drug approval. Used clinically in 30+ countries.

keyFindings: Improved survival in sepsis and hepatitis B in multiple clinical trials
Enhanced vaccine response in immunocompromised elderly patients
Restored T-cell function in aging immune systems (immunosenescence)
